text: I haven't played this game yet, but it looks like a great time. Those who did play it, how did you find it? I'm loving the remixes I heard! I have to say I really like how Nintendo announces games that are released only a few months afterwards, it makes it extra exciting everytime they have a Direct.
author: SupraDarky

text: I played with my brother and it was super cool, the soundtrack are nice too.
author: Emeric Fringant

text: I found it very fun! Definitely one of my favorites of this year
author: Dimoskid

text: Not anywhere close to necrodancer in terms of difficulty, but it's still an amazingly fun game. Ultra high replay value too.
author: L0rdMathias

text: A real good game, the content is great and the gameplay is a breath of fresh air (Crypt of the necrodancer set me free and Cadence of Hyrule taught me to fly lol). Not to mention the soundtrack... Sublime.
author: Ana Unicornio

text: I love it. I believe my initial reaction was that I've never been so amazed by something being exactly what it says on the tin. It's a lot easier than NecroDancer after you get started due to having the ability to get health refills any time you want and the fact you can get twice as much health as you'll ever see in NecroDancer, and being able to choose your weapon makes a huge difference.
author: BubbatheScrub

text: It's shorter than expected, first playthrough took 4 hours. It's a Zelda game so everything is done well. Music is great, so is art. Kinda expensive if you don't play on pouring hours into after you've beaten it...
author: Tolux303

text: Absolutely one of my favorite games of the year. Think I'll go play it again cya
author: jackal27

text:
Haven't played it but I already know the OST by heart! 
There are a lot of nice, relaxing lo-fi tracks in it but also intense, hyper and brutal songs.

author: Amsun Thales

text: The way the soundtrack is designed, most tracks have two versions. One is "calm" and one is "intense". The calm one drops out all the harsh instruments like drums and brass and is played when there are no enemies present(generally.) Intense is the full composition with all the instruments. It's just a mechanical distinction.

text: It's not supposed to, so I guess they succeeded.

text:
I've never heard of this game, but the music seems pretty good. 

Btw I have a playlist of over 850+ songs. I've even used some of your videos in my playlist.

If you want to check it out just type "Best VGM of all time" maybe with my user name too and it should pop up.Also now that I think about it I believe the very 1st song I added was a video of yours from FF Tactics lol. But yeah skim thru my list if you want and maybe it'll give you ideas of games that have good music! 

Amyways thanks for continually giving us awesome VGM!
author: Collin 255

text: To sum things up quickly. Crypt of the necrodancer was an indie games with a pretty dope soundtrack then cadence of Hyrule is a Zelda themed sequel which also has a pretty dope soundtrack so long story short it's time to update your playlist
